item.title: ハリウッドのベテラン記者で評論家、CNNのニュースレター「Reliable Sources」の寄稿者であるブライアン・ローリーが、CNNの新たな人員削減で退社することが決まった（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
Brian Lowry, the veteran Hollywood reporter, critic, and a contributor to CNN's Reliable Sources newsletter, is set to leave in the new round of CNN job cuts  —  The news outlet is cutting approximately 100 jobs as it works to boost its digital business.

item.title: NATOは16人のソーシャルメディア・インフルエンサーにサミット取材の旅費を支払い、米国防総省と国務省はさらに多くのインフルエンサーを招待した。
item.description:
Laura Dhillon Kane / Bloomberg:
NATO paid for travel for 16 social media influencers to cover its summit, and the US Defense and State departments invited more; combined audiences reach ~40M  —  - Alliance invited 16 content creators to summit in Washington  — NATO paid for travel expense, but has no editorial control

item.title: Redboxの親会社であるChicken Soup for the Soul Entertainmentの破産手続きは第7章に移行し、資産整理への道が開かれる（Janko Roettgers/Lowpass）
item.description:
Janko Roettgers / Lowpass:
The bankruptcy case for Redbox parent Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment is being converted to Chapter 7, paving the way for liquidating its assets  —  Redbox will shut down, corporate parent is being liquidated  —  The bankruptcy case of Redbox's corporate parent Chicken Soup …

item.description:
Matt Grobar / Deadline:
Random House Publishing Group is acquiring comic book and graphic novel publisher Boom! Studios; the deal is expected to close this summer  —  The Random House Publishing Group, a division of the world's largest trade publisher, Penguin Random House, has entered into an agreement to acquire comic book …

item.title: 情報源CNN、オピニオン欄制作チームをレイオフ：シニア・エディターのシーナ・マッケンジー氏も削減対象者に含まれる（Claire Atkinson/The Media Mix）。
item.description:
Claire Atkinson / The Media Mix:
Sources: CNN lays off the team producing its Opinion section, with an end date of August 9; source: Senior Editor Sheena McKenzie is among those cut  —  Staff told current operations are winding down.  —  The CNN team working on the news network's Opinion output was let go today.

item.title: 情報筋：NBAはNBAファイナルはABC/ESPNを維持しつつ、新たなパートナーであるNBCとAmazon Prime Videoとの契約をまとめる。
item.description:
Andrew Marchand / New York Times:
Sources: the NBA finalizes contracts with new partners NBC and Amazon Prime Video, while maintaining ABC/ESPN for the NBA Finals; TNT could still match  —  The NBA and network executives finalized contracts that will make NBC and Amazon Prime Video new partners, while maintaining ABC/ESPN …

item.title: WBDのデヴィッド・ザスラブCEOはパラマウントとスカイダンスの契約を「業界にとって良いこと」とし、次の大統領が規制緩和を受け入れることを望む。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
WBD CEO David Zaslav calls the Paramount/Skydance deal “good for the industry” and hopes the next president embraces deregulation “so companies can consolidate”  —  “Getting [Paramount] in solid hands and having them funded — it's a great company and a great heritage …

item.title: 米著作権局、楽曲の権利を取り戻したソングライターが実際にストリーミング使用料を受け取れるようにすることを目的とした新ルールを最終決定（Bill Donahue/Billboard）
item.description:
Bill Donahue / Billboard:
The US Copyright Office finalizes a new rule aimed at ensuring that songwriters who reclaim rights to their music will actually get paid streaming royalties  —  The new rule clears up uncertainty about who gets paid streaming royalties when songwriters take back their music rights - a trickier question than it sounds.

item.title: ロシア政府がモスクワ・タイムズ紙を "好ましくない組織 "と認定、同紙に協力するロシア人は懲役5年の可能性も（AP通信）
item.description:
Associated Press:
Russia's government declares The Moscow Times an “undesirable organization”, meaning any Russian who cooperates with the outlet could get five years in prison  —  The Russian prosecutor general's office on Wednesday declared The Moscow Times, an online newspaper popular among …

item.title: NYTのジョー・カーン氏とのQ&A：ニュースルームでの炎上、新入社員のNYT文化の定義と構築、家族財団への寄付、ガザ報道など（Clare Malone/New Yorker）
item.description:
Clare Malone / New Yorker:
Q&A with NYT's Joe Kahn on newsroom flare-ups, defining and building NYT culture among newer employees, his family foundation donations, Gaza coverage, and more  —  Joe Kahn, the newspaper's executive editor, wants to incentivize his staff to take on difficult stories, even when they might engender scrutiny, or backlash.

item.title: ラジオ番組とポッドキャスト「This American Life」は、NYTがポッドキャストを有料化するのに伴い、8月1日に広告販売をNYTからナショナル・パブリック・メディアに移す予定（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
Radio show and podcast This American Life plans to move its ad sales from the NYT to National Public Media on August 1, as the NYT looks to paywall its podcasts  —  The program will remain available through the New York Times' audio app  —  The long-running radio show and podcast …

item.title: イングリッド・シプリアン＝マシューズは、親会社であるパラマウント・グローバルの経費削減の中、1年足らずでCBSニュースの社長を辞める予定だ（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
Ingrid Ciprian-Matthews plans to leave as the president of CBS News after less than a year, amid cost cuts from parent company Paramount Global  —  CBS News may be on the hunt for another newsroom honcho. … Shaking up the senior executive structure at a major news organization in the middle …

item.description:
TMZ.com:
George Stephanopoulos replies to a pedestrian on Biden, saying “I don't think he can serve four more years”; ABC says “George expressed his own point of view”  —  GEORGE STEPHANOPOULOS BIDEN CAN'T SERVE 4 MORE YEARS … 6:28 PM PT — George Stephanopoulos tells TMZ …

item.title: メモ：マーク・トンプソンによると、CNNは約100人の雇用を削減し、2024年後半に最初のCNN.com購読製品を立ち上げる予定だが、詳細はほとんど説明しない、など（Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Memo: Mark Thompson says CNN is cutting about 100 jobs, plans to launch its first CNN.com subscription product later in 2024, but offers few details, and more  —  CEO Mark Thompson said it was “a logical possibility” that CNN might pursue a subscription bundle similar to what the New York Times offers.

item.title: シティAM編集長のアンディ・シルベスターは、デジタルファーストのニュースルームと新ウェブサイトへの移行を監督した後、ロンドンの無料ビジネス紙を去る予定だ（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
City AM editor Andy Silvester plans to leave the free London business newspaper after overseeing its transition to a digital-first newsroom and a new website  —  City AM editor Andy Silvester is leaving the free business newspaper after almost four years at the helm.
